summary: Tenerife is the biggest and most populated island of the Canary Islands, Spain. It's home to over 900,000 people and is a popular tourist destination, attracting 5 million visitors yearly. The island has two capital cities, Santa Cruz de Tenerife and Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, which share governmental functions. Tenerife is home to the oldest university in the Canaries and several notable landmarks, including Mount Teide, the highest peak in Spain and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The island also boasts unique biodiversity, with the largest number of endemic species in Europe.
title: Tenerife
